item.title: Level Up 2019: Morning Routines
item.content:encoded:
New year, new you. New year, new habits! New year, blah blah blah. Not to get too cliché here, but I did a lot of thinking at the end of 2018 about how the year went. In many ways it was the best year. It’s the year I got married to my wonderful rock of a man, Nicolas Cramer. That in and of itself will make 2018 a tough one to beat. Yet, in other ways, I am a bit disappointed in the year. I won’t go into all of why, but let’s just say I wanted to make sure 2019 was more about better myself and taking steps forward in the journey of where I want to go. This means professionally and personally. To do this, I’ve created a little bit of a campaign (for lack of a better term) for myself for this year. I’m calling it Level Up 2019. I want to take certain things in my life to the next level. Not to say that i’m going to knock it all out of the park—I just want make sure i’m making forward progress rather than swirling in place and feeling sorry for myself about it.

I’m hoping to share some of this publicly, here. You know, accountability and all. So, the first phase of #LevelUp2019 (hashtags make it official, right?!) is to solidify a morning routine for myself. I’ve landed on the first iteration, and utilized some pretty simple tools that i’m hoping you’ll find useful in your own efforts this year!

Go on, now, give it a read:

My inspiration comes from a book called Miracle Morning, by Hal Elrod, which was gifted to me in the fall of last year. While I enjoyed the read, I honestly didn’t implement any of it for a long time. Till January, to be exact! 

And if we’re being honest—I’m not so sure that I’m doing it exactly right in Hal’s eyes—but the main point is to realize that how you start your day largely effects the quality of that day, and you should be optimizing the start of your days to achieve quality in life.  

For me, I found three things that I started to implement into my own “miracle morning”:

  1. Wake up at 630. The time itself isn’t they key, you can pick whatever time works for you, but it’s important that it’s the same time everyday. No more snoozing the alarm, folks! Consistency is key. It’s the key to success for a good morning routing, and the key to healthy sleeping habits. If you can’t stop snoozing that alarm—hook your phone up across the room, set three alarms, use a wake up light—whatever it takes. If you want to set up a morning routine, you have to make sure you have the time set aside to do those things you’d like to do, and this starts with waking up at a consistent time.  You will also probably find yourself going to bed at a consistent time, to allow your waking up to be more pleasant, which then creates a better bedtime and sleep routine. Bonus!

  2. Morning journaling. Here’s something I never knew I’d be into. I’ve always been the one to try to get a journaling habit going at night. I thought, you know, reflect on the day. As it turns out, I never stuck with it. I’d have other things going on, I’d forget, or by the time I got in bed I was so tired I didn’t care about capturing any details from the day. Since I have transitioned this to the morning, I’ve been sticking to it and enjoying it! I do a little bit of reflecting on the day before, I get out whatever frustration is on my mind, and then I pep talk myself for the day. Affirmations, guys. Get with them! There’s nothing cooler than loving yourself, I promise. 

  3. Movement. If you’re like me, you wish you could workout in the mornings but it doesn’t quite fit with other things you have going on. In that case, I recommend a nice walk to get fresh air, blood flowing, and clear your mind! We’ve been walking our pup every morning for 30 minutes for the last 3.5 years. There are days when I don’t feel like it, when I just want to stay inside (looking at you, polar vortex that just froze the entire midwest), but if the weather isn’t horrible—we always go. It’s good to get our rambunctious guy some exercise and it sets a great tone for us to start our days. We don’t take our phones, we just focus on our pack. Training the dog and chatting about whatever comes to mind. It’s great time for us to bond but also to make sure we don’t just dive right into our to-do lists from the moment we wake up.

That’s it! How simple does that seem? It really is, that’s the beauty of it all. If you’re into meditation, that’s probably a great thing to slot into your morning routine! Nick meditates right when he wakes up, while I’m doing my thing, and he loves it. Before I had my morning routine, I was kind of just sitting around. I’d wake up when I wanted and feed the dog and then end up scrolling on my phone mindlessly until he was ready to go on our walk—what a waste! I felt like a blob. Now, I wake up, know what I’m going to do and I’m excited to do it. My morning routine has given me a better sense of purpose from the moment I wake up, and has done wonders for my mentality and self love lately! The simple things can sometimes create the biggest impact!

How are you going to #LevelUp2019?
Do you have a morning routine? Tell me about it below!
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: LIVE AND LET LIVE
item.content:encoded:
There's so many ideas swirling around in folk's heads about how things are supposed to be. But really, who decided that's how things are supposed to be? I've entered a point in life where many people I come in contact with feel the need to share advice with me on this stage. While most of it is welcomed, because in fact I have not been here before, still some of it leaves me feeling icky. 

At first, I was pretty offended. How nice of them to think I care about the same things as them! How wonderful for people to think I needed their ill-informed thoughts on my life! Please, people, let me know more how you think I should handle the many decisions to make for the event of joining my life with another person! 

In case you haven't guessed, i'm recently engaged. Which is the best. I can't explain the joy i've been feeling since the moment I realized what was happening. (because when I first walked into the proposal setting, I couldn't believe it was really real.) For the last 3.5 years i've shared life with a kind and encouraging partner. Seriously, he's my champion. Each day I am amazed at the level of support and love he gives me. Keep it up, Nicolas. :) 
So, he planned the most amazing proposal and ring that completely fit who we are. I honestly did not get that life with another person this way would feel so natural, but it does. While I understand how this might not matter to some—and that's okay with me—this is the coolest thing i've ever experienced in my personal life. It just is. 

So, back to this whole imposing advice thing. 
After I spent some time feeling sorry for myself that I had to listen to all of this, I came to a realization: I do some form of this, too!  We all do, guys. It's human. We draw on our own experiences to share with others, thinking we're helping them in some similar situation. And hey—sometimes we are truly helping. The point is, no one has wisdom for things they've never experienced. If they are sharing such wisdom, you have permission to smile and excuse yourself as quickly as possible. 

Moral of the story here—i've had my share of venting moments to my fiance lately. But if anything, it's made me more aware of what "advice" I choose to share. I'm trying to change up the delivery, and keep anecdotes of my own experiences to a minimum. We'll call it a test.

Another learning I've had is more of a reminder. A reminder that I know who I am, and I know my own taste. Nick and I have been getting relationship and life advice since the moment we moved in together at 6 months of dating. I think it's important that we all do two things: 
First, let's be confident in who we are! Let's love ourselves. Let's stand strong in our preferences. 
Second, let's be a bit more welcoming of our differences. Not everyone wants to do the same things that we do, or likes the same things we do, or even cares about the same things we do. I know what you're thinking, this all boils down to "live and let live", and maybe it does! 

I'm going to challenge myself to do this, and do it better. I'm going to live as me, without apologies (except when i'm grumpy and need caffeine, no one asks for that), and try not to impose that on others. In tandem, i'll be trying to accept people more. I consider myself a pretty accepting person—but sometimes I just can't hide that J from my meyers-briggs. They key here will be small, everyday things. #NoMoreJudgement

Thanks for reading!
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: SKINCARE, LATELY. [THE ORDINARY REVIEW]
item.content:encoded:
Hey there, it's me. It's been quite some time, hasn't it? I could start to explain, but I'll save us all that 2 minutes of our lives. 

Let's jump right in: Skincare! I have a confession, guys: I've pretty much stopped buying makeup. EEK. I said it. Not because I don't love it anymore, and not because I don't love testing products anymore. There are a few reasons, the main one comes down to trying to use up as much of my current collection before I keep adding more. (You can laugh, that's okay, I am chuckling a bit myself. See you next week in a makeup haul post) In that same vein, I've really been concentrating on my skin. What's the use in all this makeup if my skin isn't the best canvas it could be? Also, wearing full-coverage products on a regular basis is the pits. Also, not that 25 is anywhere close to being an age to worry about aging in the general sense—it's never too early to start taking care of your skin.

I assume, since you've landed on a blog post about skincare, you might have heard of this new brand that's blowing up in the beauty world—The Ordinary. This brand is owned by the EU skincare company, Deciem. They have quite the portfolio of skincare lines, some of which i'm sure you've heard of. The Ordinary was created to bring quality, proven ingredients to us without all the faff that results in those high price tags that give you heart palpitations. There's a wide range for many concerns, I highly recommend checking out their site and giving a read to the product descriptions, there's something for everyone. 

I have a few issues i'm targeting right now: dark under eye circles, dryness, and hyper-pigmentation/acne scars. I chose three of their products that (surprise) target just those issues! 

Alpha Arbutin 2% + HA: This baby is for lightening the appearance of pigmentation and brightening the skin, with a bit of hyaluronic acid in there to give your face a drink of water. I use this in the morning (make sure you use SPF if you do this!) on clean skin. I've noticed spots from recent breakouts fading much faster than I'm used to, and my skin feels nice and hydrated after this. 

Caffeine Solution 5% + EGCG: I'm using this AM + PM as an eye serum. It's been about a month, and I do like it. I think it plumps up and hydrates the skin under my peepers, but I'm not quite sold on the reduction of dark circles just yet. Stay tuned on that benefit.

"Buffet": This one is all about anti-aging. It's packed with peptides, amino acids, and hyaluronic acid. All good things for all ages, really. This is one of their pricer offerings (although still only coming in at $14.80), but I'm totally loving it. I use this as my PM serum and my skin drinks it up. 

So, there you go! I will absolutely be trying more products from the brand, I'm really impressed with their quality, packaging, marketing—the works. Here's looking at you, Deciem. Well done.
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: TEA TIME: MOVEMENTS
item.content:encoded:
It's that time again! Grab yourself a cup of tea (or whatever you choose to drink at the moment) and listen to me babble on about something that's on my mind! 

--

Movement is a fact of life, as a living being. Even things that don't live, move. Our brains tell our muscles to move all day long. Some movements are calculated while others are so second nature they're almost involuntary. As humans, our lives are also constantly moving. We're leaving our houses each day to take on the world. We're moving to new apartments or into houses. We're moving in and out of relationships. 

Movement is natural, it is expected, it is healthy. 

Recently, I've made a big move. I've started a new role with a new company, moving on from the one I've called home the past few years. I've been extremely busy the last few weeks closing doors while opening new ones, and it's been pretty exhausting to say the least. Movement can be terrifying. I was with my old company for nearly three years. Those three years felt like three decades at times. I learned so much, I met so many talented people, and I made some lasting friendships. I was sad to make this move, it seemed daunting when the opportunity first arose. 

Yet, it's all so exhilarating. I get to meet new people, take on new challenges, and grow as a human. I couldn't be more excited to try something new and step out of my comfort zone. I think I'm going to learn a ton and experience so many different people and projects, that I won't have a choice to be anything but happy with this move. 

I'd like to let everyone who feels they might be stuck where they are, stuck with nowhere to move, that you dictate your own movements. Subconscious or not, they're your decisions. It's engrained in our being, to explore and seek out new knowledge and experiences—so don't deprive yourself of that. Not all movements are the best, but stagnancy is never the answer. You are strong, you are smart, and you can do it!
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: PRODUCT REVIEW: RIMMEL MATCH PERFECTION FOUNDATION
item.content:encoded:
Guys, my skin is being pretty weird lately. While I've gotten my breakouts completely under control (god bless my current skincare routine), I'm still struggling with some textural issues, as well as being more combo than ever. I've always had combo/oily skin, but not real dry patches. Lately, my cheeks and temples are like the Sahara desert. I can't figure it out! 

While I'm working through that issue with different skincare products, I've also been testing out different foundations, both high end and drugstore. Most recently, I picked up the Rimmel Match Perfection foundation. I was originally drawn to this because I've been a long time lover of it's matching concealer, which is great for covering up those under-eye blues. The formula has a pretty standard liquid consistency, not super thin or thick. There's a pretty hefty scent, which is pretty standard for Rimmel— so if you're not a fan of that, beware. 

I'm going to give this foundation a solid B. It does give a decent coverage, and doesn't cling to any dry patches. Also, the 101 Classic Ivory color is a great shade match for me. The points got knocked off when it came to blending. I felt like I spent a lot of time getting it to blend into my skin. When first applied, with both a brush and a sponge, it was just sitting on top of my skin and when trying to blend it just sort of moved around, but was still sitting on top. I found if you working in very thin layers and blend well, you can build this up to be both nicely blended and get a decent medium coverage. I did also feel like I had to set this with a powder, which I haven't been doing lately due to the dryer texture of my skin, so you can take that as a good or bad thing! 

Overall, I'd recommend this to those who have pretty normal skin and want a light, dewey look for their base. 

Have you tried this foundation? Are there any others you think I should try?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: EU MAKEUP HAUL
item.content:encoded:
You had to guess I was going to do a bit of makeup shopping whilst across the pond, right? Luckily, it was the more inexpensive products I was after. Being able to walk into a Kiko store was so exciting! I could have purchased so much more but honestly, I did get a bit overwhelmed. However, the process of building my Inglot palette might go down as when I was the most indecisive I've ever been (sorry, Nick). 

But, I'll cut to the chase. Here's what I got! 

From Kiko:
Water Eyeshadow in 200: This is quite possibly the most beautiful eyeshadow I own. I mean, would ya look at it?! It's a perfect mid-toned bronze shade that's not too gold and not too brown. Also, it's metallic power is strong. Dry, it adds a wonderful sparkle, and wet, the intensity is really kicked up. I highly recommend this product! 

Extra Sculpt Volume Mascara: I knew I had to grab this because I've heard Kathleen Lights rave about it so much. If I'm being honest, however, I'm not that impressed. It does give some great volume. The formula is definitely something I can get behind. For me, the wand is where the problems are. It's huge. So, so big. Also, the hourglass shape confuses me a bit because it means i'm putting one of the widest points of the wand into the inner corner—one of the smallest spaces of my eyes. I just found it a bit messy. I have to be light handed and move pretty slowly to avoid getting this all over my face. It could be user error, but it's not my favorite. 

From  Inglot: 
Walking up to the products, I knew I was going to have to make my own palette. I decided that 5 shadows would be a good place to start! I also knew that I wanted to grab one of their sculpting powders...which snowballed into the pretty little blush that also made it's way into my bag. Here's the shades:

Eyeshadows
#35 White, shimmery color for highlighting brow bone + inner corners. 
#357 Matte transition shade, the perfect mid-toned brown!
#154 Shimmery, metallic bronze. Hello, my go-to eyeshadow. 
#335 Matte burnt-orange & #299 Matte burgundy:  I stepped out of my box a bit with these two, and I'm so glad I did! I really love using these shades for some autumnal color in an eye look. I never thought I would like such warm shades on my complexion, but I stand corrected! 
I did notice I need to use an eye primer with these shadows. 

Sculpting powder: #505, a perfect shade for my pale Fall + Winter skin. 
Blush: #55 . This is a very cool toned pinky-mauve which is fitting for the cooler months! It gives a gorgeous flush of color to the face. 

Have you tried either of these brands?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: MUSINGS VOL. 4
item.content:encoded:
Hello friends! 
If you're in the US, I hope you had a fabulous holiday weekend. And if you're in the Mid-West, I hope you spent most of it outside soaking up this glorious weather we've been having. 
To start this short week off right, I have another set of musings for you! 

READING: 

Just finished: A re-read of Is Everyone Hanging Out Without Me by Mindy Kaling. Did you catch my Instagram post about this? (ps- if you're not following, get to it!) Sometimes, when I'm in an off-mood, I turn to books I've read and that brought me joy. I've also read Why Not Me? by Mindy, but this specific rut called for her first book. I love her story and her witty sense of humor, it leaves me "lolling" for hours. 

Just started: Good Morning, Midnight. I don't have much to say yet about this one as I'm only on page 16. What drew me to it was—let's be honest—the cover showcasing a beautiful starry sky. Upon reading the synopsis, it seemed to have a similar feel as The Martian, which is a favorite of mine. My mom ended up picking up this new book, and passed it along to me after finishing. Can't wait to see how it unfolds! 

LISTENING:

Anderson Paak: I'm not sure I can do him justice with any description I come up with. I really dig his sound. It's pretty different to most things I listen to, and we've been playing him over the speakers in the house quite a bit. Thanks to Nick, for this music discovery. 

Same Drugs- MisterWives: This cover of a song I already enjoyed—has been repeated many, many times in my headphones the last couple of weeks. I can't wait for more music from MisterWives. They are sure to cure any bad mood you come across. 

TRYING:

Keto Double Chocolate Brownies: We recently got a ketogenic cookbook, Bacon & Butter as a gift, and I've been cooking almost exclusively from it's arsenal of yummy recipes. We've loved everything we've made so far, so I can't wait to try this special treat! 

SWOONING: This amazing kitchen (smeg fridge dreams), Japanese inspired plateware, this camera bag, and these cute-as-can-be pineapple donuts made by my good friend (and amazing baker/blogger), Sarah! 

Are you reading, listening, trying or swooning? Let's chat about it!
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: 5 INEXPENSIVE PRODUCTS YOU CAN'T AFFORD TO MISS
item.content:encoded:
There are plenty of lists out there showing you great, affordable products or affordable "dupes" of higher end products. I would be lying if I said I'm not kind of addicted to reading ever last list of that nature. However, I've recently noticed that I do have quite a few personal favorites that I reach for often but don't hear talked about much in the beauty community. Today i'm going to talk through five of them with you! 

The first one is a product I've been using for years and is hands down my favorite CC cream. The NYX CC Color Correcting Cream in Green Light/Medium was, for a very long time, something I actually used as a primer. In my makeup loving journey, I've always been very into full coverage finishes, but I don't love the feeling of having caked up product. (does anyone??) This CC cream gives a light-medium coverage, and the green tint helps to cancel out redness—the main reason why I love it. I have quite a bit of redness in my skin, so I have always made use of green color correctors. This one is pretty cool in that it does come out of the tube green, but as you blend it into your skin it turns to a skin-tone shade and evens out the complexion nicely without giving you that weird green mask look. I still use this as a primer for some occasions, but It's also become my go-to weekend base when I want a lighter look. 

Second, is the Revlon Photo Ready Skinlights Face Illuminator in Bare Light. I either use this as a primer, or to mix in with my foundation. It gives the most beautiful, natural glow to the skin. It's not overly dewey or greasy, and skins into the skin nicely. I love using it on days when I'm just feeling a bit dull, like I need a pick-me-up. It's great for mixing in with a drier/matte foundation to give some glow without taking away from the matte finish. 

Next we have the two Colour Pop brow products. I love both the gel and the pencil formula. I use the pencil on an everyday basis and the gel for special occasions, longer days, or when i'm just trying to have fuller brows. They both have great pigment, and the colors are spot on. I have the shades Blondie and Dope Taupe. Usually, I go for a taupe shade in brow products because they're the only shades that are cool-toned enough, and I do like a darker brow with my lighter hair. I got them both thinking I would love Dope Taupe and Blondie could be good to test out. However, the Blondie shade is the perfect cool-toned dirty blonde color that I'm actually reaching for it more! The best part about these?: The pencils are $5 and the gel pots are $6. HELLO! It's a no-brainer. The only downside is they're only available online, but the price tag still makes them worth it. Plus, Colour Pop has tons of other highly rated products with similarly low price tags so you can definitely put together an order worth shipping! 

Lastly, I'll mention the Maybeline Lash Sensational Full-Lash Effect mascara. This was talked about quite a bit when it first launched, but thats died down a bit and I don't see why. L'Oreal has always been the winner for me in terms of drugstore mascaras, and they still hold some of my favorites, but this lovely little number has made it into my daily rotation and I continue to go back to it. The length, separation, and definition it gets is beautiful.
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: DECEMBER 2015 FAVORITES
item.content:encoded:
Happy New Year!
December has come and gone, and time got away from me while planning to write this post, so it’s a bit late. However, I really found some products I fell in love with in the month of December, and I wanted to share that with all of you!
Without further adieu:

Lorac Pro 2 palette
A recent *treat yo-self* purchase of mine. The Lorac Pro shadows are just some of the best on the market hands down, and many of you probably already know this. I love the cool tone of this palette. It’s got a wonderful selection of mattes and shimmers, light neutral shades and some bold ones thrown in for a bit of fun. I’ve worn shadows from this throughout the entire month!

Morphe M438 brush
Late November I made a Morphe Brushes order, and this lil’ beaut was one of the brushes that became mine! It’s meant to be a contour brush, but I have been loving it for either setting the under-eyes with powder, or for applying a powder highlight perfectly! It’s narrow, tapered shape let’s you get a precise application for your face powder needs.

L’Oreal Telescopic Carbon Black & Voluminous Carbon Black
The mascara combo from the heavens. These aren’t new, but they’ve cycled back around to the a-team in my everyday makeup stash. I love love love the voluminous formula for top lashes. Hands down I get the most compliments when I wear this mascara. There’s zero clumps, gobs of volume, and they still look fluttery and soft. As for the telescopic formula- it’s pretty much the only one I want to use on my lower lashes. The wand is so thin and precise it’s perfect for those small hairs. Not to mention that both of these are some of the blackest mascara’s you’ll find.

Harney & Sons peppermint tea
Peppermint tea is the bomb. The complete bomb. It’s hands down my favorite type of tea to drink, and what’s not to love when it’s in this beautiful tin!

Darling Magazine Issue No. 14
I’ll be giving more details about this issue of Darling in a future post, but man I love this magazine. From it’s thoughtful production quality to the thoughts of real people who empower you with every word, Darling magazine is definitely one to check out.
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: A LETTER TO JULY
item.content:encoded:
Dear July, 

You’ve always been a mystical month for me. You’re the month I was born in, 24 years ago. You’re usually hot, muggy, and rainy—but always beautiful. You bring green leaves and blooming flowers. You bring amazing time spent with friends and family. You bring love. 

This year, July, you’ve been pretty stellar to me. You reminded me that I am surrounded by compassion and companionship. You brought me travel, and a break from reality that I so desperately needed. On the heels of your pal June, I was at the end of my rope. Stressed about being constantly on the go in the upcoming weeks, stressed about money, stressed about work. I’ve been on the edge of making some big changes for a while now and July, I thought for certain you’d see them. Instead, you’ve instilled some new perspectives in me. I’m choosing to step outside the stress, clear my head of unnecessary noise, and concentrate on what’s in my heart. While your successor, August, could very well go through some winds and turns with me, I will be comforted that you’ve given me the space to relax in preparation for what’s to come. I know now that it’s okay to feel like the noise around is holding you back, but it’s not okay to let that control you. 

Thank you, July, for letting me bask in your sunny rays, sweat through your hottest days, and keep my feet firmly planted on the ground. 

-Susan  

 

This post was inspired by an amazing series Emily Diana Ruth started on her YouTube Channel. Check it out!
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: Travel Makeup Bag
item.content:encoded:
You may know this already, but very recently I went on a trip to Lisbon, Portugal. The wonder of this city is certainly something to behold. The colors got me right in the feels. bright blues, yellows, greens, reds—the whole rainbow. Even being a monochrome lover, I was in awe of just how bright and cheerful Lisbon is. But, more on that later, I promise.

Today I’m here to talk about the makeup I chose to travel with on this trip. Being that we were in a city, so I knew I’d be wearing my normal face of makeup (even though most days I even went with less than normal). I was, overall, very pleased with what I brought along! I didn’t feel like I was missing anything, and I even could have left behind some products.
I have three big tips for packing makeup for a trip to make sure you have what you need and no excess: 

  1. Do a first edit of what you think you'll bring a few days before the trip and put that into your makeup bag. Over the next few days, only use that selection to do your everyday makeup. This will help you realize if you're missing anything or if there are things you don't actually reach for. 
  2. Hunt down those travel sizes! While this results in spending a little cash, I find it totally worth it. Sometimes my favorite products can have pretty bulky packaging, so it helps to hunt down the smaller size. Plus they're so cute! Ulta and Sephora will usually have what you're looking for. 
  3. Stick to the basics. Unless you have some big events during the trip, I recommend sticking to everyday products. If you're anything like me, when you are ready to get out and explore a new city the last thing you're trying to do is spend an hour getting ready. Especially when you'll be walking around and likely getting sweaty. Not to mention if you plan to pick up any new products while you're gone, you'll want room to get them home! 

Now, for what I took, let’s go in the order of application:
Primer: I picked up a primer I’ve been dying to try, the Hangover Rx Primer from Too Faced. When I spotted the travel size I knew it was the right time to test it out, and I was pleased! I don’t think it actually prolongs the wear of my makeup, but it certainly creates a great base.
Foundation: Two favs came with me: The Tarte Amazonian Clay and the It Cosmetics CC Cream. I honestly only used the It Cosmetics ones! I put some of the Tarte in a little travel pot and just never felt like digging my fingers in there. Also, I already had a travel size of the CC cream, so it was an easy one to reach for. The other bonus—it has SPF 50—perfect for walking around on sunny days!
Concealer: I brought along a trial size of the Becca Under Eye Brightening Corrector, and the Bare Minerals Complete Coverage Serum concealer I’ve been loving lately.
Powder: skipped it! I know. right? I didn’t even miss it either..
Brows: You won’t be surprised here either, the ABH brow powder in taupe along with the ABH clear brow gel made the cut.
Bronzer: My ever faithful Tarte Amazonian Clay bronzer in Park Ave Princess. The one that looks very dark and very shimmery in the pan, but somehow ends up being the perfect bronzer for me when applied! I picked up a fresh one for this trip and it was lovely.
Blush: I had a few options, but you had to guess Tarte’s Exposed was coming along. It goes with everything! It’s a beautiful shade that you just cannot go wrong with. My second blush option was within the Lorac Refined Romance Palette, which is a deeper more berry toned shade.
Highlight: I went with a trial size of the Becca Shimmering Skin Perfecter Poured in the shade Opal, and then the two highlights in that Lorac palette. I used the golden one from the palette most often! Opal is a bit intense for me, and the poured formula can be pretty hard to blend. I do like it, but i’m glad I’ve got the small one as I’d never be able to use up a big one!
Eyeshadow: I stuck with just the Lorac palette, as it has all I’d need! Now, I did pick up a decent amount of new eyeshadows while in Lisbon, but more on that in an upcoming post!
Eyeliner: Two goodies, both in travel size: Kat Von D Tattoo Liner in Trooper, and Marc Jacobs Highliner in black.
Mascara: final travel size item of the bunch: the Tarte Lights, Camera, Lashes. This is an old favorite so I was glad to have it back!
Lips: I went with 1 red, 1 nude, and 1 pink. For the red, the classic Sephora Cream Lip Stain in 01. And the nude, the one I can’t stop wearing, Maybeline Color Sensational in Sin-a-mon. And lastly, the pink, I’ve been loving the cool tones of the Bite Beauty Multistick in Macaroon, so it made the journey!

That’s it! That’s all I took. It does seem like a lot all listed out, but I promise it wasn’t too much once it was all packed. I had room in my makeup bag for purchases and that’s what I was looking for. I hope you’ve enjoyed this post, I really love reading ones like this from others as you really find out what products a person can’t go without!

What are your favorite products to travel with?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: FALL LIP LOVES
item.content:encoded:
Everyone knows that fall is the time to whip out the deep browns, reds, and berry shades. In clothing, decor, eye looks, and (my favorite) lips. I have quite a few favorites I can't wait to start wearing on a regular basis. During the warmer months I fall deep into the nude lip zone, so it'll be fun to start experimenting with colors again! 

Many of my go-to's are drugstore items, which makes them that much better! 

In oder, from left to right:

Revlon: Raspberry Bite
A deep magenta with a cream finish. A classic offering from Revlon! I've had this for years. 

Revlon Colorburst Matte Balm: Sultry
A muted dark rose with a matte finish. These smell minty, feel cooling, and last beautifully! 

Rimmel Kate Moss: 107
A deep berry red with a matte finish. This one can be a bit drying, so I'd recommend exfoliating your lips before wearing.

Kat Von D Everlasting Liquid Lipstick: Lollita 2
This one is lighter than the rest. It's described as a 'terracotta nude', and that pretty much sums it up. This is one of my favorite liquid lipstick formulas! 

NARS: Scarlet Empress
Similar to Raspberry Bite, but a bit brighter. This is a satin finish which I like to wear as a light layer patted in with my fingers to give that 'stained lips' look. 

Maybeline Matte: Divine Wine
A beautiful, deep, neutral red. This has a very matte finish. I love the wear time of this formula, although I do sometimes find it a bit gritty. 

Maybeline Color Sensational: Deepest Cherry
A satin finish, and not the most opaque in color, but I love it again for the stained effect. It can be built up to be quite dramatic, which also looks beautiful!
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: SUBTLE YET FUN 'HALO' EYE LOOK
item.content:encoded:
I think I've mentioned before that i'm quite the YouTube junkie. I can spend hours watching tutorial after tutorial. The gals + guys in the YouTube beauty community are so talented! A look I see people create often is the 'halo eye' where you have a deeper shade on the inner and outer corners of the eye, with a lighter shade in the center. This look can make your eyes look bigger and rounder, and it just looks really cool! 

I recently repurchased an old drugstore fav: the Wet + Wild Comfort Zone palette. This baby has had it's fair share of the spot light, and I think is most famous for a shade which is pretty close to Mac's Club eyeshadow. I've used that shade (something that looks kind of scary in the pan) in this look, and I don't find it overwhelming at all! 

The shade in question, the 'definer' shade in the bottom right of the palette, is a deep brown color with a bright blue shift. The blue only catches in certain lights, which really gives the look some edge without being too out there. I took this shade on the inner and outer corners of the lids, and then blended it out through the crease. From there I took the 'browbone' shade in the top left and mixed it with the 'lid' shade just underneath it to place on the center of the eyelids. Blending is key here, so be sure to go in with a fluffy brush that doesn't have any product on it to blend seamlessly. 

To finish off the eyes I took the brown 'crease' shade (left) and smudged it in along the lash line before piling on the mascara (as usual). What do you think? Is this something you would wear? It turned out way less dramatic than I expected—and I'm really enjoying it!
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: ALL ABOUT THAT BASE
item.content:encoded:
I know, I know, the punny title. It's been used a million times. But I still love that song, so I'm at peace with it. 

As you can guess, I'd like to share with you my current makeup-base routine. That means foundation, concealer, powder, the works. My skin has been oddly dry lately, so I've been testing out different combinations and I think I've hit gold with this one! 

First, there's the foundation. This oldie—and goodie—is back in action. The Tarte Amazonian Clay 12-Hour Full Coverage Foundation has been around forever, and loved by me for years. I had this stashed away because it is a thicker formula which had proven to catch on dry patches of skin from time to time. However, I recently decided to try out a trick I learned from Tati: add one drop of a facial oil to your foundation. I tried it, thinking it would result in my face being a giant grease puddle. However, it worked beautifully! It added the right amount of moisture to this foundation, making it exactly what I needed. It blends much better and still yields the great coverage you expect. Also, my skin isn't even getting extra oily by the end of the day, which I was worried about, so it's a win! I've been using this sample of the Fresh Seaberry Moisturizing Face Oil and I'm really enjoying it! 

Next, the concealer combo that's gracing my under-eyes. These two from Bare Minerals are amazing options for those of us who have dark circles, but also are a bit dry under the peepers. I first go in with the Stroke of Light Eye Brightener in Luminous 1, and then in with the Bare Skin Complete Coverage Serum Concealer in the shade Light. The brightener makes me look awake even when I've had zero sleep, and the concealer is very full coverage but still feels amazing on the skin. Since it's a serum concealer, it's actually doing great things for the skin while hiding all your late-night Netflix binging secrets! 

Lastly, another old friend of mind is back in the rotation. The NYX HD Finishing Powder in Banana. I've talked about this recently, so no real reason to linger. I'd just like to ask you to try this out. It's so brightening and doesn't make you look cakey at all. 

What are your favorite base products?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: TWO PRODUCT SMOKY EYE
item.content:encoded:
You guys. I'm pretty much giddy like a small child over this eye look because first, it's so easy. And second, the star of the show is so affordable I just can't get over it. Enter: the Elf Flawless Eyeshadow Quad in Tantalizing Taupe. This is two dollars. Two. Stinking. Dollars!! I was gifted this, but I will be hunting down the other quads in this line to purchase. I did a quick post on Instagram talking about this product, but I love it so much I had to feature it on the blog as well! 

The colors are a neutral lovers dream and perfect for anyone who's looking to just get some basic eyeshadows to use for everyday. The formula is fantastic as well. They're pigmented, blend really well and do not crease. I kid you not—they do not crease! I have worn this for an entire day and at the end, the shadows look the same as they did when I put them on first thing. 

My favorite way to wear this, creating a neutral smoky eye out of just two products, goes a little something like this:
Top shade: a beautiful champagne color all over the lid, under brow, and inner corner. 
Second shade: mid toned brown all through the crease and along the lower lash line. 
Third shade: darker brown, blended through the crease as well but focused on the outer-v of the eyelid. 
Fourth shade: used to set in a subtle wing liner created initially with the Bite Beauty Multistick in Cocoa (review here). The colors are very similar and setting the liner with the powder shadow really locks it in place. 

There you have it. You need this quad in your life!
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: CURRENTLY LOVING VOL 4
item.content:encoded:
Guys. We're already halfway through September. WTH?? There's only two-ish weeks till the Portugal trip—so this past weekend I got into hard-core planning mode to get content all ready to go and pre-scheduled for while we're gone! Don't forget to follow me on Instagram, as it's probably the only form of social media I'll be using while we are in Portugal. 

While I was organizing what posts to write and photos to shoot, I realized I've been pretty exclusively using a set of products for a solid 3 weeks now. I do try new things quite often, but I haven't been able to put these products down! Grab a snack and a cup of tea—there's quite a bit to talk about. 

I'll go in order of application, excluding base. I've got a whole post coming up soon on my current routine for my makeup base + what products I've been using religiously! The first thing I do after my base is brows. To be honest, I pretty much consider them part of the base since I can't leave the house without doing something to my brows. I went to Ulta a few weeks back to pick up another tube of my tried and true brow gel, the Clear Brow Gel from Anastasia of Beverly Hills, and saw they had this fun kit which included that gel, a dual-ended brush, and their brow powder all for $36 and I couldn't pass it up. The brow gel was full size in the kit and for reference, on it's own it costs $22. I do love a good deal, especially when it's on products I am repurchasing! I got my normal shade, Taupe, thinking I'd just use the powder here and there since I've been loving the Colourpop brow products. However it's become a daily staple! Having two shades really helps build natural looking brows, and the brush is pretty small at first look, but I'm obsessed! 

From there we'll go to the cheeks, where I've been using the Lorac Color Source Blush in Spectra. This shade is your typical pink color, a usual shade in my blush rotations. I love how creamy this powder is. It's pretty pigmented but builds beautifully. I also went digging through my sample stash recently and came across the cutest little sample of Balm Desert by The Balm. I've been using this as a blush/bronzer/contour shade. It has a pretty sheen to it and the color works so well just alone on the cheeks. 

Next stop is the eyes. While I haven't been wearing this eyeshadow everyday, I have been using it more than you'd think considering the color. This is the Urban Decay eyeshadow in Tonic. It's an amazing duo-chrome shadow that's lavender with pink + blue reflects. I picked this up a long time ago but couldn't really figure out how to wear it until recently. I love this on the inner corner for a bit of intrigue or smudged along the lower lash line. It gives such and interesting twist to an everyday look. Plus, it fits right in with the moon child/fairy thing that's a big trend right now—which I'm totally into. For the lashes I've been coating them in the new offering from L'Oreal: the Voluminous Feline. I'm not sure this is going to become a staple for me after this tube is gone, but it's definitely great for some volume and length that isn't clumpy! 

Lastly, a new (to me) lippie I can't put down is the Maybeline Color Sensational 'The Buffs' Lipstick in Sin-a-mon. This browny-grey nude gives the most beautiful wash of color and isn't too glossy. It's a color you don't even need a mirror to apply and will go with every look—it's earned it's home in my handbag. 

Phew, that's it! Have you tried any of these items? What are you loving right now?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: THE HIGH AND LOW: LIQUID HIGHLIGHTER
item.content:encoded:
Let's be real—the highlighter category is becoming quite saturated. Every brand releases shade after shade, each rising in intensity, for all of us to give our complexions a glow that can be seen from the space station. 

The other aspect is the different forms of highlighter. Today, I'm going to share with you the only two liquid highlighters which I think you need. 

We'll start on the low end and work our way up: The NYX Born To Glow Liquid Illuminator in Sunbeam. This is a gorgeous pinky-toned glow that can be worn quite subtle or built up to the level of the photos you see on Instagram. This shade works well for us paler-skinned ladies, and they have three other shades so most should be able to find one that suits them! You can find this at Ulta and most Target stores these days—for under $8! 

The high end option is by BECCA, did you expect anything different? BECCA is known for owning the highlighter game when it first became a thing. From their original shades to their collaborations with Jacklyn Hill, they've been the go-to for glow giving products for a while. While their powders actually aren't my favorite (I feel they really emphasize texture), nothing beats the Liquid Shimmering Skin Perfecter in Moonstone. The shade matches my skin wonderfully, and their shade range is pretty large. The liquid formula of these highlights is a bit more subtle than the other forms, but it can still be built up nicely. This is my most used highlighter. To make it even better—I buy the travel size, which is only $19, and it takes me forever to go through it. Aka, I'm still working on my first tube. Definitely a great option if you don't think you'd use up the big one before it expires! 

Do you use either of these? Are there other top contenders I should check out?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I use the NYX for daily use and love it! I'll have to look into BECCA for more selective use. Thanks for sharing :)
I don't think you'll regret picking up an option from BECCA! They're fab!

item.title: BLUSHING FOR FALL
item.content:encoded:
Ahhh, Fall, my old friend. So close, yet so far away. To say I am excited would be the biggest understatement you've heard all year. It's (clearly) my favorite season, could you tell?
Although summer makeup has really had it's moment in my routines this year, I'm giddy just thinking about dark, vampy lips and smokey eye looks. To all the berry tones and browns: get on my face! Blush has always been one of my favorite makeup steps, and Fall is when I break out all of my mauve-y rose shades. These can work all year round, really, but the cool tones really just fit the mood of Fall, don't they?

This shade of pink gives the most natural looking flush to the cheeks on my skin tone and I have collected quite a few over the years. Three of my favorites are the ones you've seen above: Milani Romantic Rose, Stila Convertible Color in Peony, and the H&M Powder Blush in Cameo Pink. 

 

What's your favorite thing about fall? Let's chat!
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: THE LIQUID EYELINER EDIT
item.content:encoded:
For a long time, I had quite the love affair with liquid eyeliner. I was the cat-eye queen. I wore one everyday without fail and didn't touch many other products. I still hold true to my belief that winging out some black eyeliner is the easiest way to look fancy for an occasion, while it's also the easiest way to look edgy for very different occasions. 

This summer I loosened my grip on the old dependable look and started to fall in love with eyeshadow. While I am still exploring that relationship and loving it, I recently had a root around my eyeliner bin and found that I have accumulated many, many tubes of the stuff. So of course, I played around with all of the different formulas and quickly remembered which ones were my favorites. As I've tried so many, I thought I'd pass my knowledge on to those who might be in search of the perfect black liquid eyeliner. 

Let's start with the ones I love, stand by, and will repurchase a million times over: 
L'Oreal The Super Slim: I kind of hate this one when I first bought it. It's a felt tip pen that is a bit dryer than what i've been used to working with. It sat in the drawer for a few weeks before I pulled it out again to give it another whirl, and it had really grown on me!. The nice thing about this, and the reason it is a love of mine, is how matte it is. I like to use it to create a softer flick for a more smokey look. 
Maybeline Line Stiletto: Do I even need to explain this one? It's been around for many moons, and was my very first liquid eyeliner. For that, it holds a special place in my heart. And I still buy it!
Kat Von D Tattoo Liner: Another product that probably needs no explanation. This baby has a brush tip, which I didn't know would make all the difference it does! I've actually received a handful of sample sizes of this as well, so I haven't had to purchase a full one in a while, but when I'm out—you can bet I will pick it up right away. This one is my go-to for long days or events. It's matte, opaque, very easy to use, and lasts forever. 

For the ones I don't love: 
Eyeko Fat: I don't really get the point of this offering. It's such a huge applicator I can't quite figure out how to get any sort of clean line out of it. Also, it's not the most opaque so it takes a couple of coats to build that up. 
Revlon Super Skinny: I had high hopes for this. However, I actually find this applicator to be too skinny! I should have known from the name, right? I prefer a bit of a thicker applicator as it just won't take as long to apply. 
Stila Stay All Day: This one will be controversial, I know it. This is a cult favorite in the beauty community that so many people swear by. The thing that guts me about this eyeliner is that the formula is pretty much perfect. It's matte, opaque, and long lasting. However, again it's the applicator that kills me on this one! It's another felt tip, but it's very flimsy. I found that after a few uses, the very tip of it kind of balled up and wasn't holding product. You have to know that the tip is important for getting that crisp line. Once that happened, it became too much of a hassle to use this, and sadly it's just been sitting around collecting dust. 
Kat Von D Ink Liner: This formula is quite different from it's sister I mentioned before. It's rather watery and needs building up to get the right opacity. Also, it's a little more of a shiny finish which isn't my favorite. 

Needless to say, I'll be clearing out the ones I don't like to just edit down to the ones I reach for often!

Do you have any favorite liquid liners? Any I should try?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: HOW I DUO-CHROME
item.content:encoded:
I don’t know about you, but lately I’m really getting the duo-chrome vibes. I’ve always loved opal, holographic things, and other pretty light-reflecting items. 

When it comes to duo-chrome, it’s having a big moment in makeup. See: Urban Decay Moondust palette, Makeup Geek Duo-Chrome shadows, the Kat Von D Transformer Liquid Lipstick, the list goes on. 

I’ve purchased some makeup items in the past, but haven’t really gotten comfortable wearing them in many looks. One place I have found to let my duo-chrome flag fly, however, is my nails! 

I have an obscene amount of nail colors like this, considering the amount I actually wear, but we’ll look past that.  I have a few all-time favorites in my collection: OPI Breathe Life, Essie Nude Beach, and H&M Science Fiction. 

OPI Breath Life was a limited edition release many years ago, but you can still find it on Amazon! It’s the most traditionally opalescent. It’s base is a pearly white with blue and green-ish shifts. It’s beautiful. The perfect color for a wedding shower or heck, even the big day! This is a go-to for me on my nails since it’s subtle but still gives off a little something. The proceeds from this little guy went (and probably still go) to lung cancer research, which hits close to home for my family and makes it a little more special. 

Essie Nude Beach is similar to Breath Life in that it’s quite sheer, but it’s a baby pink with a pale blue shift and sometimes even looks a bit orange. It’s a newer find of mine, but fits right into the realm of what I love to wear on my nails on an everyday basis. 

H&M Science Fiction. This one is, quite obviously, a bit farther out of the box for me—but would ya look at it? What a beaut. I will say, when applied to the nails it pulls very green, and you lose a bit of that deep blue that you see in the bottle. Still, it’s a dream, right?

 

What are your favorite ways to wear duo-chrome? Do you have any favorite products?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: #TheMultistick
item.content:encoded:
If you are into makeup and haven’t heard of these by now—go to the Bite Beauty Instagram account! They’ve done an awesome job with the release of their newest product, The Multistick to generate some serious hype. Live swatching, showing colors used in many different ways, the works.  
I’ve been able to try out three colors (Blondie, Macaroon, Cocoa) , let’s see if they live up to that hype!  


Pros:


Color selection
The range of shades is awesome. not only do they range from dark to light, working with many different skin tones, but they are also all in colors that would actually make sense to use on the lips, eyes, and cheeks. Some are a bit bright and wouldn’t be in everyone’s taste for all three, but they can definitely work. See how Mariah Leonard (Gal’s Guide) used the shade Nectar. I’d never be bold enough to rock that—but she definitely makes it look wearable. 


Formula  
The formula is interesting and welcomed. Given that each bullet contains 33% powder helps it to have a finish that looks great on the skin, very matte but not overly so. I will say, it is a bit tricky to blend out on the cheeks, but I found warming it up with my fingers before applying to the face helped. 

 

Cons:


Size
The size of a tube of lipstick, which is all fine and dandy but if you’re using it in all 3 use cases then you’re going to run out pretty quickly.


Lasting power
This varies. They didn’t seem to last very long on the eyes, but really love the cocoa shade as eyeliner. On the lips, it lasted as long, or even a bit longer, than your average matte lipstick. 

 

How I used these colors: 


Eyes
I went in with Blondie all over the lid and took Cocoa lightly through the crease, then smudged into the lash line for some smokiness. These blended well with a synthetic brush + fingers, as to be expected. I did try them out with a natural hair brush and while it was okay I would definitely recommend to stick to synthetic as you would with other cream products. 

Cheeks
I’ve only been brave enough to try the shade Macaroon so far on the cheeks, it’s definitely bright but when blended out it’s a nice mid-toned cool pink. The interesting thing about this shade is the swatch looks a bit warmer than it shows up on cheeks and lips, so it was cooler than I expected once I put it on. Personally, I’m a fan of cooler toned pinks, but just something to be aware of! 

Lips
I got ballsy and tried all three shades out on my lips. While Blondie doesn’t suit me (too concealer-like), I love Macaroon and I’m not hating Cocoa, surprisingly. Cocoa also comes out way more cool toned when put on the lips than you’d expect, and these are very opaque so if I wanted to rock a stone-cold brown vampy lip, it would be a great option. Macaroon i’ve been wearing on the lips a good amount. Again, more cool toned than you’d expect, but I’m digging it. Isn’t so bright that it overpowers you, and these last a decent amount of time besides when eating/drinking. 

 

Overall, I'm a fan. I have a few other shades I'd like to pick up, but they aren't rocketing to the top of my wishlist just yet. 

Have you tried these yet? What colors do you have your eyes on?

 

 

 

 

Disclaimer: I received these products as samples from Bite Beauty via Influenster. All opinions are my own.
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: CURRENTLY LOVING
item.content:encoded:
It's been a while since I've given you a peek into my everyday makeup stash by telling you what products I can't stop using in recent weeks—so here we are! Let me know if there's anything you've been loving that I should try! 

Essence Silky Touch Blush in Adorable
This might look like your basic pink blush. And honestly, it is. But that’s why it’s great! It was $2.99, and the quality is great. It has the slightest bit of sheen once it’s applied to the cheeks. It might just be the most natural blush I’ve ever worn! I definitely think if you’re looking for a staple blush that’s good quality and a steal, this is the ticket! 

It Cosmetics CC Cream
This beautiful product doesn’t need much of an explanation, you already know! It’s a lovely product that provides nice coverage, a gorgeous finish, and so many skin benefits! I currently am using the travel size in the shade Light, as my tube of Fair is a touch too light for me right now. 

Maybeline Better Skin Concealer
A newer option from maybeline, this concealer has been lovely for my dry, crepe-like under eyes. I’ve been testing out a few different day-time eye creams, and one really dried out my skin under the peepers. Since then, I’ve had to put away some of my favorite concealers that are a bit thicker (NARS Radiant Creamy Concealer has been benched), and this pretty tube of delight has subbed in. It’s not the most full coverage option, but it is very lightweight, bendable, and it doesn’t suck the life out of my under eyes. 

Bare Minerals Marvelous Moxie lipstick in Take Charge
Such a great nude! It looks a bit pinky-orange in the bullet, but comes out as close to a true nude as I will get on the lips. It’s creamy, so it doesn’t last a particularly long amount of time, but it’s so easy to apply, even without a mirror, that I don’t mind donning it on a night out. I wore this to my 25th birthday celebrations with a champagne and bronze eye look + lots of highlighter, and I’ve been kind of hooked since! 

Colourpop creme gel eyeliner in Over Board
These eyeliners. WOW. Incredibly pigmented, blend beautifully, last all day! What more could you ask for in a liner? And they offer so many different colors! I secretly have a periwinkle blue number stored away that I haven’t been brave enough to wear yet. I use this shade, overboard, a warm bronze shade to line the upper lash line then smudge it in with my finger. I also love using this to tight line because it give some depth without being too harsh. Did I mention this is $5? I can’t wait to pick up more of these!  

Colourpop brow pomade in Blondie
I've spoken about the Colourpop brow products before, initially I used the pencil a ton. It's affordable and I really liked the product, but I went through it very quickly. I had picked up this pomade at the same time, and originally thought it was a bit much for my brows, but I've fallen in love with it over the last few weeks! You have to take a light hand with it, but you really can create a natural brow look. I use an Anastasia of Beverly Hills dual-ended brow brush that has a very precise angled brush on one side and a spooly on the other to apply. I love to go natural for an everyday look and really build it up if I am feeling a bold-brow day.
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: THE EVENING ROUTINE THAT SAVED MY SKIN
item.content:encoded:
I haven’t talked about it much here, but I’ve struggled with skin issues for quite a few years. As normal, I had hormonal breakouts in my teens, that carried into college, and continued still into post-grad years. I got to the point, which I know many can relate to, where I thought “shouldn’t I have grown out of this by now?”
That’s a tricky place to put yourself in. Because yes, some people do grow out of teenage hormonal acne. However, the hormones don’t stop. Sometimes, they balance out and don’t affect your skin, but I am someone who is still affected by hormonal breakouts at 25.
I started doing the research I could to figure out what I could do to fix it, and that led me to the products i’m using today. Specifically, I’d like to share my evening skincare routine, as this lineup has given me the best skin I’ve had in a decade. Before we dive into the products: to clarify, I have combination skin that sometimes leans oily and sometimes leans dry, and all things in-between It's also pretty darn sensitive and reactive, so I know quickly what will or will not work. Now, for the products I am now in love with: 

Cleanser: Philosophy Purity Cleanser
I discovered this last year, when I was looking for a new cleanser to give a deep clean without aggravating my very, very sensitive skin. I took to YouTube (as per usual tendencies of mine) and two of my favorite ladies on there suggested this: Kathleen Lights and Casey Holmes.
I started with the sample, and to be honest I did not like it at first. It made my redness flare up on the first couple uses, so I dropped into my “idk what to do with this product” bin. But, something made me try it again a few weeks later, and for whatever reason I did not react the same as the first time, and instead I fell in love! This cleanser removes makeup like no other I’ve tried. Most days I don’t even need to use an eye makeup remover before cleansing. I’ll go in once to remove makeup, and then once more to double cleanse. I went off of this while testing some other products a while back, and decided I couldn’t get away from it.

Serum/Treatment: Curology prescription
Let me start this part by saying this startup is a totally cool concept. Tailored prescriptions without having to go to the dermatologist? Sign me up. When you sign up for this system, you fill out some questions regarding your skin, share photos of your problem areas, and explain anything you’ve already tried. From there, a dermatologist will contact you and formulate your perfect prescription. This is a monthly subscription, but you’re sent a 90 day supply every three months. This has definitely changed the way my hormonal breakouts are. They are less intense, and disappear very quickly. I also love this product because you’re instructed to only use it at night. It’s one cream, once a day. Super simple and a no brainer if you’re at the end of your rope with everything you’ve tried up to this point!

Eye Cream: Kheils Midnight Recovery Eye
This is a recent discovery, but I hear about it everywhere. It’s super hydrating for the under eyes and feels luxurious going on. My under eyes have been quite dry and sad looking these days. The bags are real, people—and so are my dark circles. I’ve heard this little tube works wonders on combating all of those things, so I am really looking forward to see how it works on me!

Moisturizer: Philosophy Renewed Hope in a Jar
Another Philosophy number, this moisturizer has completely changed the texture of my skin. One of the problems I was having, apart from normal breakouts, was little bumps along my forehead and temples. I couldn’t figure out what caused them or how to get rid of them—until I tried this. Again, I started with the sample, and when I went off of it for a few days I realized the change it was making. All of those bumps are now gone! I do stick to using this only at night, even thought it’s meant for daytime use. I have combo/oily skin, and it’s a bit much for me to use under makeup all day. But I wake up each morning with soft, smooth skin, and it’s all thanks to this!

Have you tried any of these or any other products that you consider skin saviors?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: THE PERFECT ALL-IN-ONE PALETTE FOR FALL
item.content:encoded:
I know what you’re thinking—Susan, don’t wish Summer away so quickly! 

I could say I’m not trying to, but that might be a lie. It’s been a hot and humid one in the Midwest, and I’m so ready for the cool breeze of Fall. 

I’m bringing this to you in August, however, because now’s your chance to get your hands on your perfect all in one palette to use this fall. This is the Lorac Refined Romance palette, created for this year’s Nordstrom Anniversary Sale. Meaning, I believe you can only get this before August 8th. See why I’m bringing up Fall so early? 

Now, for starters, the packaging of this product is kind of meh for me. I love florals, but I love the sleek, simple looks of Lorac’s other palettes. Getting inside this bad boy, however, makes the cover nothing to think about. You’ve got 6 shadows, in a perfect color combo for fall. A nice shimmery white, a gold shimmer, and a garnet shimmer occupy the top row. Then you have the perfect matte light brown, a satin taupe like color, and a matte garnet shade. I’m pretty much obsessed with these color choices. You may even catch me wearing some more fall inspired looks in August, because I love the colors so much. You can create many different looks, and the combo of matte and shimmer gives you everything you need. 

Moving over to the cheeky side of things, the palette has two highlighters, one a pale champagne color and one a bit pinky, and a beautiful dusty rose matte blush. For starters, this is the blush shade i’m most drawn to in the cooler months, so that’s an instant win. The highlighters, while I am not sure how to wear the pink one just yet, are very pretty as well. They’re not as pigmented as I expected, being Lorac, but they build up really nicely. I think i’ll end up using the pink shade as either eyeshadow or mix it in with the blush shade to create a more luminous flush to the cheeks. 

Formula-wise, the eyeshadows technically aren’t their “Pro” formula. However, I think they’re just as good. Everything is very pigmented as you’d expect and blend easily. The shimmers pack a punch and the mattes aren’t chalky or patchy. 

I can say the same for the blush, formula is nice, color payoff is good, blends well. And since I mentioned the highlight formula above, that covers it! 

This beauty will definitely be traveling with me, and help me cut way down on the amount of products taken on a trip. It’s a great multiple use product, and a hell of a deal! Check it out! 

 

Do you have any favorites from Lorac or the Nordstrom Anniversary Sale?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: REVIEW: BECCA X JACLYN HILL SPLIT PANS
item.content:encoded:
Champagne Pop. The infamous highlighter to top all highlighters made by BECCA in collaboration with Jaclyn hill herself, is something I honestly never thought I’d pick up. I love a good highlight, but I was concerned about how gold it was and frankly thought it wouldn’t look good against my pale skin. Because of that, I’ve not purchased or tried any of her collaborations with BECCA. Then, the Champagne Splits happened. I had been eyeing up the BECCA luminous blushes for some time, and when I saw they were doing a split of the Champagne Pop highlighter and Flower Child blush I didn’t think twice before ordering it.  

First off, would ya look at it? Swoon. 

I think you can see that the packaging is to die for. Mixed metals, a big mirror, and quite big pans for a two in one product. It feels weighty in the hand, really luxe, not that I expected anything less! 

To get on to the products themselves—there has been a lot of controversy around these guys in the beauty world. After an incident regarding another recent collaboration between Jaclyn and BECCA, people  seemed to have their magnifying glasses out ready to scrutinize their next move. I’ve read the ingredients lists, there are some differences between what’s in these split pans and the full size versions of each product. Why is that? BECCA says they’re in the process of reformulating some of their products to be better their customers. Are they allowed to do that? Absolutely. I’m of the opinion that if you don’t like the ingredients in a certain product, don’t buy it! 

I, for one, love the blush. Flower Child is a perfect mid-toned pink shade with a slight warm shimmer running through. What people say is true, these babies are pigmented. A little goes a long way and you’ll need to be sure to tab off any excess before hitting your cheeks. But, once on and blended out, I’m a huge fan. It’s been a fast favorite of mine. 

Champagne Pop, while flipping gorgeous in the pan, might be a bit too warm toned for my skin, as I suspected. I’ve worn it a few times, and really loved the way it looked on the cheeks, but I’m still experimenting. I’m not sold on the texture, I think my Lorac Illuminating Highlighter in Daylight is a bit softer and more densely pigmented, but it’s by no means scratchy. I have found that I love using it as an inner corner highlight on the eyes! 

All in all, I have no doubt I’ll get use out of it. It’s a great way to get an intro into two different BECCA offerings at once, especially since I can’t say I’ve ever seen the pan of any of my blushes or highlighters. I see this as a very easy to choose cheek duo to pick up if you’re looking to consolidate for everyday or for traveling! 

Have you tried these or any other BECCA cheek products?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: ESSIE GEL COUTURE
item.content:encoded:
Last week, I was looking for a new, longer lasting nail option for a weekend away. I really didn’t want to tote along my nail polish choice and remover in case of some massive chip (a usual for me). Also, I’m a bit jealous of all the people who get shellac, but i’m way too weary to get it done myself. As someone who has the nails that are still showing the years of acrylics, anything that involves that electric buffer roughing up the surface of my nails has me running the other direction. I’m talking I haven’t had acrylic nails on in close to 7 years, and you can still see the ridges in my nails. 

So, I stick to the plain ole polish and deal with removing and re-painting every few days. 

When I happened upon the Essie Gel Couture line in my local drugstore I was instantly drawn in. Not only is the packaging a very cool twist (get it? HA!) on their original bottles, but they killed it with the color selection. I picked up the purple-y grey shade called Take Me To Thread. 

Guys—this stuff is legit! It claims to have up to 14 day wear. Now, I don’t know about that exactly. When you type a lot your nails wear down faster, it’s just a thing. But this did last beautifully for 7 solid days. On the 7th day it had only chipped slightly on one nail. ONE NAIL! I filed that sucker down and was good to go. To have a nail polish even last 3 days with zero chips on my nails is a miracle. 

*runs away from keyboard to go buy all remaining shades in collection*...
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: SUMMER BEAUTY ESSENTIALS
item.content:encoded:
Summer is officially upon us! Time to soak up the sun and get that tanned skin and tousled waves we all dream of (real or faux). If you're like me, you tend to take much better care of your skin when more of it is showing. Sorry, Winter skin. Summer is when I stock up on the all things that keep my skin silky smooth. I'm sharing with you my five favorite beauty products for summer, covering body + hair, and bonus: they're all available at the drugstore!  

[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="4608.0"] * indicates a gifted sample [/caption]

First up, let's talk exfoliation. I have a couple tips in this department. If you have sensitive skin like me, you should definitely stick to sugar based scrubs, as opposed to salt based scrubs. Sugar is much gentler on your skin, doesn't dry you out the way salt does, but still gives you the softest results you could hope for! My hands down favorite scrub is the Tree Hut Shea Sugar Scrub. It comes in many different scents, all of which are divine and leave you smelling great. I also think this scrub actually moisturizes my skin as it's exfoliating it. Thank you, sugar scrub. I've tried many different scrubs and for the price—this just can't be beat! My next exfoliation tip: get yourself a foot file. Unless you're getting regular pedicures or constantly sleeping in those lotion therapy socks, my guess is you could use some help on your heels. It's natural for them to get dry, and mine get extremely dry and cracked. I was recently able to try out the Amope Pedi Perfect* foot file, and it's a dream! You can use this wet or dry, and it has two different speeds depending on how intense you need it to be. The file spins, and you just glide it along the area in question until you've reached your desired smoothness! Perfect-o. 

Now, after you've gotten rid of all the rough or dead skin, you know you have to moisturize! I tend to stick to and old favorite, the Aveno Daily Moisturizing Lotion. It's as basic as you can get, but it does exactly what you need it to! I also love that it's unscented. Another sensitive skin plight, sometimes perfumed lotions can really irritate my skin, so for daily use I stick to non-perfumed lotions. One thing I will say, though, is although it's lacking scent, it still contains alcohol. Since alcohol dries out your skin, it's not the best. While I've never had any issues with the Aveno lotion and I will continue to use it, I am always hunting for an affordable body lotion that doesn't contain any alcohol. If you have recommendations—please share! 

Something I can't leave out of a Summer beauty essentials conversation is SPF. I'll go ahead an be the one thousandth broken record—you must wear SPF! It's just a no-brainer. Now, I have a favorite, and that's the Neutrogena Beach Defense Water + Sun Protection in SPF 70. I know that a few of you just got wide-eyed on that one. But hey, I'm very pale. If this girl is getting any color, it's usually not real. I use such a high SPF because in the sun, I tend to just burn. And I burn quite fast and quite badly. It's painful, lasts a long time, and then all the skin peels away and I'm back to being pasty white. Due to that, I stick with a higher SPF to protect from burns. I use this whether i'm out at the pool or just walking around outside. Getting burnt is no fun, and ending up with melanoma is also no fun. Take it from someone who used to fry herself in the tanning bed as a teenager—it's really not worth it. Protect your skin, it's the only skin you have!
Additional note: I also really love the smell of this SPF! Very beachy and vacation-like without only smelling like gross SPF. 

Last but definitely not least, let's talk summer hair. If i'm being honest, I tend to rock the messy waves year round. This means I've tried many sea sprays. And I mean, many. From high end to low, I always come back to this. This being the John Frieda Beach Blonde Sea Waves Sea Salt Spray. It's under 10 dollars, and a few spritzes through the ends of your hair after curling it will give you that "just came from the surf" look you've been after. There are definitely some nice sea sprays on the high end of things, but seeing how often I go through the stuff (this is my 4th bottle of the John Frieda), I can't justify spending so much. Try this one out if you're looking for a great alternative to those pricier options! 

Interested some Summer appropriate makeup to go along with your soft Summer skin?
Check out this post! 

 

 

 

Thank you to Amope for kindly sending me the Pedi perfect™
Rechargeable Wet & Dry Foot File foot file for review.
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: SPRING/SUMMER FACE: LIGHT + BRIGHT
item.content:encoded:
I don’t know about you, but I love a good smoky eye and a bold lip. I’m totally willing to spend time blending away trying to replicate those beautiful looks ladies like Sharon and Jacklyn create. However, when the temps rise in the midwest, the humidity skyrockets as well and piling on the products is basically just asking to look like a panda by noon. Luckily, I’ve found some go-to (some old, some new) products for the hotter months that keep my look light and bright to match the sunny weather.  

Mario Badescu Facial Spray- this isn’t a new product on the market, but it’s new to me. After hearing everyone rave about this spray, I figured it wouldn’t hurt me to try it out. First off, the price tag is amazing. Secondly, the scent is amazing. And thirdly, the refreshing feeling it gives is—you guessed it—amazing. I tend to use this as the last step in my skincare routine, right before going to sleep. I also use it right after applying my makeup, and throughout the day when I need a bit of a refresher. It’s perfect for those days where you’re overwhelmed with the heat and need a bit of a cool down.  

Clinique Even Better Foundation SPF 15- I keep coming back to this darling. I’ve used it for years—this is probably my 4th or 5th bottle of the stuff. I love Clinique bases, they were some of my first higher end base products ever purchased! (I used to layer up the Superpowder when I got hit with acne in my teens..it wasn't pretty but we've all moved on) This offering from the brand packs a decent punch in the coverage department, but retains a dewy, skin-like finish. I do like to use a pore filler with this and powder in my oily areas, but all in all it’s a great option, and the SPF makes it good for the sunnier days!

Bare Minerals Marvelous Moxie Lipgloss in Trailblazer- This was gifted to me by lovely friend Sarah. Just in the nick of time as I had it on my wish list to buy this spring! It’s a delightful peachy-nude gloss that really compliments lighter makeup looks. It’s the first Marvelous Moxie gloss I’ve tried, and I really like this formula. Not sticky at all and has a nice minty scent with a cool feeling on the lips. I think i’ll grab some more of these! 

Lorac Light Source Illuminating Highlighter in Daylight- This baby is new. Ohhh man, I gravitated right toward this. There are a few shades in this range of highlighters from Lorac, but there was no question that the shade Daylight was the one for me. It’s a pale champagne gold that is all of the glow you could ever want without any of the glitter. It’s smooth and creamy, and I’ve basically been dipping my entire face in it on a regular basis. I’m loving applying it with the Real Techniques Setting brush; going for the tops of the cheek bones, the nose, cupids bow, under the brow, and even all over the lid on most days. (wasn’t kidding—dipping my face in it.) I’m pretty obsessed with how this looks, and I think it’ll be a staple in my routine for a long time.

Clinique Cheek Pop in Melon Pop—I picked up this little number a few months back as I don’t have any other blushes in a similar color. I tend to lean towards the mauves and pale pinks. I was debating between this shade and the shade Nude Pop (much closer to shades I usually go for), but i’m so glad I went for Melon Pop! It looks a bit daunting in the pan, but it’s not the most pigmented, which I find good for a blush. It gives the most beautiful wash of bright, peachy color to the face, and comes with an adorable little daisy embossed on it. What more could you ask for?
item.dc:creator: crameresusan@gmail.com

item.title: FIRST AID BEAUTY: SAMPLE HAUL AND REVIEW
item.content:encoded:
I've been trying out new skincare products here and there lately looking for a great set of simple, straightforward products that take care of my sensitive, dehydrated skin. I've heard so many great things about First Aid Beauty, but never tried them before, so I decided to try multiple options!
